intro: Myosurus breviscapus var. africanus, commonly known as the African short-capped myosurus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland and forest margins, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy surface, while the flowers are usually white or pale pink. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
